_decoded_content.title: Support for adding and configuring all "plugins" in Meltano UI
_decoded_content.description:
Per https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/3527#note_960415549

Without writing a ton of code, we should try to open up _all_ plugin types to being added and configured via Meltano UI.

- Option A: Consolidate `Extractors` and `Loaders` into `Plugins`.
- Option B: Add one more Page for `Utilities` or `Plugins` or `Other Plugins`.
- Option C: Add another page for each plugin type.

I think my personal preference is just to have a single "Plugins" page where plugins are added and configured (option A). But what we choose will depend on many factors including long-term product direction and relative effort of each approach after sizing/scoping.

_decoded_content.title: Meltano UI "Add extractor/loader" experience post-2.0
_decoded_content.description:
After #3283+ lands, we'll want to review the functionality of Meltano UI as it relates to adding plugins.

A few updates I can see being fairly important:

1. (Lower pri.) Allowing the user to define settings in the UI if they are not already set.
   - In the meanwhile, we could simply instruct the users to do this in the CLI.
2. (Higher pri.) Updating the UI so the user can add plugins from the hub, perhaps using the API endpoints or by using the output of `meltano discover`.
3. (Medium pri.) Allowing other plugins to be added/configured in the UI, in addition to extractors and loaders.

_decoded_content.title: Add Frontend Testing
_decoded_content.description:
### Problem to solve
Frontend tests provide a simple and provable method of making sure the code written works as suggested.


### Target audience
Us, as engineers to make sure everything is going well, and our users/investors to know we're serious about taking care of bugs before they become an issue.


### Further details
E2E and unit testing is an important feature of any modern, robust architecture. As Meltano UI grows both in functionality but also use it is vital we write tests to make our product less bug-prone and as a selling point to customers and investors that we've made a quality product.


### Proposal
By using testing suites like the below:

- https://v2.vuejs.org/v2/guide/testing.html
- https://storybook.js.org/
- https://www.chromatic.com/
- https://jestjs.io/
- https://www.cypress.io/

_decoded_content.title: Consider something like 'Meltano Desktop' - An Electron app as an alternative (and possible future replacement) for the current web UI
_decoded_content.description:
### Tasks
- [x] Add more links for research
- [ ] Add Figma files for visual research
- [ ] Add possible time table for development


### Problem to solve
This isn't really solving a problem. This is just a nice to have/Makes us look even more legit.


### Target audience
Non-command line users but really anyone and everyone. I imagine that if this gets off the ground we will have very few folks using the web app anymore (like how Slack has a webapp but nobody really uses it...)


### Further details
Meltano has so far been a CLI-first company. As we create a more robust UI, it makes sense to explore/create a desktop app that would be useful to folks who don't have any CLI experience and don't want it.


### Proposal
Leveraging Electron to use the existing webapp to build a potentially cross platform application that abstracts away the startup tasks for getting Meltano going while also having all of the bells and whistles that exist already.


### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?
Have a bug-free desktop app that builds upon the web UI experience.


### Links / references

- [Electron](https://www.electronjs.org/)
- [Vue Electron Builder](https://nklayman.github.io/vue-cli-plugin-electron-builder/)
- [Smashing Mag Article on building the above](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/07/desktop-apps-electron-vue-javascript/)
- [Electron/Vue FS component](https://itnext.io/a-file-system-browser-component-for-electron-vue-js-applications-eab285fbb3cb)
- [Electron-Vue](https://simulatedgreg.gitbooks.io/electron-vue/content/en/)
- [Working with IO files in an Electron App](https://medium.com/jspoint/working-with-files-i-o-in-an-electron-application-b4d2de403f54)
- [Beginners Guide to Electron](https://medium.com/jspoint/a-beginners-guide-to-creating-desktop-applications-using-electron-824da5665047)
- [Selecting a directory in Electron](https://jaketrent.com/post/select-directory-in-electron)

_decoded_content.title: Missing settings in the UI for _state / _catalog and settings in inherited plugins
_decoded_content.description:
### What is the current *bug* behavior?
When adding the `_state` or `_catalog` as as setting in a plugin, this setting is recongnized (value is taken into account), but the setting is not shown in the plugin configuration in the UI. Those two settings are extra settings for an extractor plugins. The [state](https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#state-extra) and the [catalog](https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#catalog-extra) are both documented.

Additionaly, settings in inherited plugins (non inherited settings) are not shown in the plugin configuration in the UI. But once configured over the CLI, the setting is visible in the UI.



### What is the expected *correct* behavior?
All the plugin relaated settings should be shown and editable in the UI (unless set as non editable). 



### Steps to reproduce
Set _state and _catalog as followed for an extractor plugin:
```
settings:
 - name: _state
   kind: string
 - name: _catalog
   kind: string
```

For the problem with inheritent settings you will see it by configurating a target as follows:
```
  - name: target-stitch
    namespace: target_stitch
    pip_url: target-stitch
    executable: target-stitch
    settings:
    - name: client_id
      kind: integer
    - name: small_batch_url
      kind: string
    - name: big_batch_url
      kind: string
  - name: target-stitch-test
    inherit_from: target-stitch
    settings:
      - name: token
        kind: password
```

The token won't be visible when configurating over the UI. But as soon as you set the token over the UI with the following command: 

`meltano config target-stitch-test set token test123`

You will now see the token field in the UI and be able to edit it.

_decoded_content.title: Can CI (securely) auto-deploy sample of the latest Meltano UI?
_decoded_content.description:
Opening this issue to discuss if/how we could setup a PR-specific deployment endpoint that would allow quick preview and testing of Meltano UI updates.

Currently, I think we need to either share screenshots or build and deploy locally on our own workstations.

_decoded_content.title: Meltano UI marks logical replication sync as "failed" if there are no no WAL messages before timeout
_decoded_content.description: I’m running a postgres  -> snowflake pipeline with log-based replication, and it works, but when there are no new WAL messages (nothing changed in the source), and the job reaches the ~~logical_poll_total_seconds limit~~ (actually 4 minutes, which not what this is set to) the Meltano UI marks the job with a red :warning: icon as if it failed. The last line of the log is simply another Waiting for first wal message line.

_decoded_content.title: Saving changes from UI deletes empty lists from meltano.yml
_decoded_content.description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.

If you are submitting an issue with a tap, please include:

- account details
- target details
- entities selected  with meltano select (if you have selected any entities), as the bug may be related to a specific entity
- the full elt command you are running
- full output of the meltano elt command. Logs can get pretty long, so you can add the full log as a snippet in the Meltano project and add a link in the issue.
--->

### What is the current *bug* behavior?
Saving a setting from the UI when using include_path config files causes a crash, since empty lists are removed from meltano.yml



### What is the expected *correct* behavior?
UI shouldn't be failing after a plugin update


### Steps to reproduce
create a meltano.yml that provides only
`include_paths`
and empty lists like
```
... 
schedules: []
plugins:
  extractors: []
...
```
Then save change in plugin loaded from included path.
The above action will remove empty lists from meltano.yml


### Relevant logs and/or screenshots
![Selection_402](/uploads/29400a1deb3373e6ed3583effec0c558/Selection_402.png)



### Possible fixes
initialise all lists that can be defined in included_paths with an empty list
I suspect that the issue is located within the merge strategy.


### Further regression test

_decoded_content.title: API endpoint for testing an extractor instantiates an ABC
_decoded_content.description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.

If you are submitting an issue with a tap, please include:

- account details
- target details
- entities selected  with meltano select (if you have selected any entities), as the bug may be related to a specific entity
- the full elt command you are running
- full output of the meltano elt command. Logs can get pretty long, so you can add the full log as a snippet in the Meltano project and add a link in the issue.
--->

### What is the current *bug* behavior?
_What is happening now?_

From a slack converstation (https://meltano.slack.com/archives/CMN8HELB0/p1632924967171100), it seems like the test endpoint is instantiating the abstract base class `PluginTestService` instead of `ExtractorTestService`.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?
_What should be happening?_

The endpoint should test an extractor correctly.

### Steps to reproduce
_How one can reproduce the issue?_

Try hitting the `POST /<plugin_ref:plugin_ref>/configuration/test` endpoint.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots
_Please use code blocks (\`\`\`) to format console output_

```
[2021-09-29 16:13:56,137] [74486|MainThread|meltano.api.app] [ERROR] Exception on /api/v1/orchestrations/extractors/tap-hubspot/configuration/test [POST]
[...]
TypeError: Can't instantiate abstract class PluginTestService with abstract method validate
[2021-09-29 16:13:56,140] [74486|MainThread|meltano.api] [INFO] Error: 500 Internal Server Error: The server encountered an internal error and was unable to complete your request. Either the server is overloaded or there is an error in the application.
```

### Possible fixes
_If you can, link to the line of code that might be responsible for the problem or suggest a fix_

Replace `PluginTestService` with `ExtractorTestService` in the function body.

### Further regression test
_Ensure we automatically catch similar issues in the future_

- [ ] Write additional adequate test cases and submit test results
- [ ] Test results should be reviewed by a person from the team

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description:
As a start, I think it would be good to prioritize based on:
- urgency of getting feedback
- relative implementation difficulty
- symbiotic relationships between issues

_decoded_content.title: Show inherited settings differently in the UI
_decoded_content.description: Unlike in `meltano config <plugin> list`, it's not currently clear in the UI whether a value that's shown in a form field was inherited from the parent plugin, or if it was set explicitly on this child plugin.

_decoded_content.title: Let plugin labels be set in UI
_decoded_content.description:
Plugin definitions in `meltano.yml` already support the `label` property, which is reflected in the UI, but the UI cannot currently be used to actually see or modify the label.

When plugins can inherit from each other (https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2491, https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2492), this would help users distinguish between the different plugins.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description:
As a start, I think it would be good to prioritize based on:
- urgency of getting feedback
- relative implementation difficulty
- symbiotic relationships between issues

_decoded_content.title: Add way in UI to add discoverable plugin that already exists another time using inheritance
_decoded_content.description:
Like http://meltano.com/docs/plugin-management.html#explicit-inheritance, but in the UI.

I imagine that discoverable plugins would _not_ disappear from the "Available" section on the Extractors or Loaders page, and that users would have an option to hit "Add to project" another time.
The user would need to enter a unique name for the new plugin (since the discoverable plugin's own name was already used the first time it was added to the project using a [shadowing definition](http://meltano.com/docs/project.html#shadowing-plugin-definitions)). We may also want to tell the user that they could inherit from the existing plugin instead, with the benefit of inheriting config ,etc.

- urgency of getting feedback

_decoded_content.title: Add way in UI to create new plugin that inherits from an existing one
_decoded_content.description:
Like http://meltano.com/docs/plugin-management.html#plugin-inheritance, but in the UI.

I imagine this would be a dropdown option on an existing plugin on the Extractors or Loaders page. The user would need to enter a unique name for the new plugin, and we should make sure the config form reflects the inherited config.

_decoded_content.title: Let user disable autoscrolling in UI job log modal
_decoded_content.description:
This is really annoying but I'm not proficient enough in JS or Vue implement a fix.

We just need some logic around https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/blob/master/src/webapp/src/components/pipelines/LogModal.vue#L112

with some state like `scrollWithLogUpdate` which is set to true when the user scrolls to the bottom of the logs, and set to false when they perform a scroll up action. When `scrollWithLogUpdate` is true, call `utils.scrollToBottom`, otherwise, don't.

_decoded_content.title: Schedule `env` is not taken into account when running pipeline from UI using "Run" button
_decoded_content.description:
As mentioned in this Slack comment: https://meltano.slack.com/archives/C013EKWA2Q1/p1602090041066200?thread_ts=1602089529.064700&cid=C013EKWA2Q1

We can fix this by adding `**schedule_payload["env"]` here: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/blob/7d630d558c44b14b3fa2e7449293ce52d6eac49b/src/meltano/api/executor/__init__.py#L37

_decoded_content.title: Let extractor and profile configuration to be managed from "create/edit pipeline" modal in UI
_decoded_content.description: We could allow a configuration profile (https://gitlab.com/groups/meltano/-/epics/51) to be explicitly selected, and/or we could default to one named after the pipeline.

_decoded_content.title: UI stores settings with `kind: date_iso8601`, e.g. `start_date`, as YYYY-MM-DD, without timestamp required by RFC3339
_decoded_content.description:
Per https://github.com/singer-io/getting-started/blob/master/docs/CONFIG_AND_STATE.md#special-fields, start dates should conform to the [RFC3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt) specification, which requires a timestamp, e.g. `2017-01-01T00:00:00Z`.

The UI date picker currently stores values without a timestamp.

milestone.title: Backlog

_decoded_content.title: Don't expand env vars in settings shown in UI
_decoded_content.description:
`tap-postgres`'s `schema` setting is set to `$MELTANO_EXTRACTOR_NAMESPACE` by default, but shows up as empty in the UI since the env var does not exist there.

We should really not be expanding env vars in that form at all, since users shouldn't accidentally destroy the dynamic setting when they open the modal and save without realizing that they're overriding something.
